messages.title: It’s YOUR choice
messages.content: Dear residents, Whatever your issue or political opinion, I want to serve as your local Member of Parliament. I don’t want to go to the House of Commons for the status or the job security. I want to represent the area and work hard all year round for local residents. Thank you, Ed Fordham

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ed Fordham agrees with Vince Cable - we need fairer taxes and strong action to build a more sustainable economy.
Passionate about education - a school governor at Hampstead School, Phoenix and UCS (Frognal).
Serious about tackling climate change and for more social responsibility on the environment.
Opposed Labour's illegal war in Iraq, and has worked hard to reach out to international community groups here in Hampstead and Kilburn.
Exposed the plans to sell off Hampstead Police Station and fight against prostitution and illegal DVD trading on the Kilburn High Road. Champions our local green spaces.
Campaign against Post Offices closures and stood up for traders over weekend tube closures.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour and the Tories say that the Lib Dems can't win here... but Ed Fordham’s Liberal Democrats are the bookies favourites to win!

issues.economy: Agrees with Vince Cable - we need fairer taxes and strong action to build a more sustainable economy.
issues.education: Passionate about education - a school governor at Hampstead School, Phoenix and UCS (Frognal).
issues.environment: Serious about tackling climate change and for more social responsibility on the environment.
issues.governance: Opposed Labour's illegal war in Iraq, and has worked hard to reach out to international community groups here in Hampstead and Kilburn.

endorsements.endorsement: I’m backing my friend Ed Fordham to be the next MP for Hampstead and Kilburn.
Former American governor Howard Dean, a key figure in Barack Obama’s 2008 election, backs Ed Fordham's work as extraordinary and compared his work to that of the American president

quotes.text: Labour and the Tories say that the Lib Dems can't win here... but Ed Fordham’s Liberal Democrats are the bookies favourites to win!
quotes.source: Campaign leaflet description of betting odds

images.caption: Ed Fordham speaking into a microphone.
